results.title: Joshua and the shadow
results.creator_credit: John Lange, Kandi Lange, Joshua Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with the way people react to themselves by telling a story in animation about a man who reacts to his shadow in many ways, from avoidance to aggression, until he discovers light, a tool with which he can control his shadow. Compares this to the tool of understanding, used to control emotional shadows. No commentary, music and sound effects only.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Lange, Kandi Lange, Joshua Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions

results.title: Joshua and the blob
results.creator_credit: John Lange, Stephen Bosustow, Joshua Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with the effect of external influences on a person’s thoughts and behaviour by telling about a person who reacts in various ways to a creature he does not understand. Shows that as his knowledge increases, his behaviour is more effective and his reactions more positive. Animated.

results.title: Joseph Campbell and the power of myth. Episodes 4-6
results.creator_credit: David Grubin, Catherine Tatge, Apostrophe S Productions and Public Affairs Television
results.brief_description: The final three hours of interviews, conducted by Bill Moyers, with world authority on myth, Joseph Campbell, shortly before his death in 1987. Episode 4 - “Sacrifice and bliss” Campbell discusses the role of sacrifice as a necessity for rebirth and the need for each of us to find a sacred place in today’s modern world. Episode 5 - “Love and the goddess” Covers both the growth of romantic love associated with the 12th century troubadours and the worship of woman as goddess, earth mother and Virgin Mary. Episode 6 - “Masks of eternity” Campbell provides challenging insights into God, religion and eternity as revealed in Christianity, Buddhism, Native American Indian beliefs and the theories of Jung and Schopenhauer.

results.title: Joseph Campbell and the power of myth. Episodes 1-3
results.creator_credit: David Grubin, Catherine Tatge, Apostrophe S Productions and Public Affairs Television
results.brief_description: When Joseph Campbell died in 1987 at the age of 83, he was considered one of the world’s foremost authorities on myth. He wrote over 20 books (eg “The Hero with 1000 faces” and “Masks of God”) and saw mythology as the song of the universe. In the two years prior to his death, Bill Moyers conducted this extensive series of interviews with Campbell at the Californian ranch of filmmaker, George Lucas, whose film “Star Wars was influenced by Campbell’s writings. In episode 1 (“The Hero’s Adventure”) Campbell discusses the function of the hero using “Star Wars” to illustrate this. In episode 2 (“The Message of the Myth”)he reveals the universality of many religious myths, such as the creation myth, and in episode 3 (“The First Storytellers”) he stresses the importance of ritual as enactment of myth.

results.title: Jose Iturbi. Part 2. Harpsichord
results.creator_credit: Reginald le Borg, Rudolph Polk, Walter Lowendahl and Artists Films
results.brief_description: The well-known concert pianist and films star, Jose Iturbi, explains how the harpsichord functions. To demonstrate his explanation, he plays a composition by Jean Phillipe Rameau; as he plays, close-ups of his hands and feet show clearly the pedal-work and fingering. Iturbi then plays Liszt’s Eleventh Hungarian Rhapsody on the piano.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Reginald le Borg, Rudolph Polk, Walter Lowendahl and Artists Films

results.title: Jordan Valley
results.brief_description: This film aims at giving some impression of Palestine and its people, and at throwing light on some of the ideas and sayings made familiar to many through bible readings.

results.title: Jordan Peele's fake news PSA with Barack Obama
results.brief_description: Jordan Peele turned his humour and filmmaking skills to creating a deepfake video of Barack Obama to draw attention to the dangers of the technology.

constellations_other.name: Dismissing the truth
constellations_other.description: The dismissal of Gough Whitlam by Governor-General Sir John Kerr is one of the most controversial moments in Australian politics. Whitlam’s rebuttal imploring the electorate to ‘maintain the rage’ was immortalised on TV and took on the gravitas of Shakespearean tragedy.

results.title_for_label: Jordan Peele’s fake news PSA with Barack Obama
results.description: In a sobering example of the potential for ‘deepfake’ technology to create alternate realities beyond the cinematic sphere, in 2018, BuzzFeed and director Jordan Peele (Get Out, Us) voiced a cautionary PSA in which former U.S. president Barack Obama appears to offer contentious opinions on the history of the Black Panthers and President Trump. Peele’s production company created the clip using a combination of old and new technology: Adobe After Effects and the AI face-swapping tool, FakeApp. Peele’s intention was to draw attention to the capacity for AI to generate photorealistic fake videos that could be mis-used to spread disinformation. The clip ends by urging viewers to critically assess what they see on the internet and to ‘rely on trusted news sources’ to avert the potential dystopia that awaits us in a post-truth era of fake news.
description_for_label: In a sobering example of the potential for ‘deepfake’ technology to create alternate realities beyond the cinematic sphere, in 2018, BuzzFeed and director Jordan Peele (Get Out, Us) voiced a cautionary PSA in which former U.S. president Barack Obama appears to offer contentious opinions on the history of the Black Panthers and President Trump. Peele’s production company created the clip using a combination of old and new technology: Adobe After Effects and the AI face-swapping tool, FakeApp. Peele’s intention was to draw attention to the capacity for AI to generate photorealistic fake videos that could be mis-used to spread disinformation. The clip ends by urging viewers to critically assess what they see on the internet and to ‘rely on trusted news sources’ to avert the potential dystopia that awaits us in a post-truth era of fake news.

results.title: Jordan Paul: one teacher's approach
results.creator_credit: Vaughn Ohern, Gary Schlosser and Extension Media Centre
results.brief_description: Jordan Paul’s approach to the drug problem is to relate to his students, by any means he can, in order to communicate about drug abuse. His approach is non-directive, he has problems to over come as an authority figure, but he promotes the substitution of people as an alternative to drugs. High school students discuss aspects of drug education.
